metadata.title: CVE-2021-3752 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s Bluetooth subsystemin the way user calls connect to the socket and disconnect simultaneouslydue to a race condition. This flaw allows a user to crash the system orescalate their privileges. The highest threat from this vulnerability is toconfidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-17-generic - 5.15.0-17.17
linux-image-5.15.0-17-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-17.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-17-generic - 5.15.0-17.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-17-generic-64k - 5.15.0-17.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-17-lowlatency - 5.15.0-17.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-kvm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-gke - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency - 5.15.0-22.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-22.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1003-oem - 5.17.0-1003.3
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required
